name: improview
summary: improview appears to be an early-stage project focused on improving and organizing documentation, with the README indicating ongoing development and an active, living project.

name: ilikeyacut
summary: ilikeyacut is a native iOS hairstyling app monorepo that lets users try on different hairstyles via Gemini's nano-banana (Flash Image 2.5). The stack includes a Swift iOS frontend and a serverless backend implemented as Go-based AWS Lambda functions, deployed with AWS SAM templates for a modular, scalable beauty-tech mobile experience.

name: wallcrawler
summary: Wallcrawler is a self-hosted, AWS-backed remote browser platform that orchestrates LLM-powered browsing using Playwright for browser automation and Stagehand, with a Browserbase-compatible API surface. This monorepo bundles infrastructure-as-code via AWS CDK, Go-based Lambda services, a Node/TypeScript SDK, and UI components to deploy a multi-arch Docker solution that persists browser contexts in S3 and supports JWT-based session flows.

name: jobseek
summary: Jobseek automates job search and screening by orchestrating Wallcrawler headless browsing across job boards (Stagehand drives automated browsing and extraction; Wallcrawler SDK handles sessions and results) through a Next.js 15 app with API routes and a Server-Sent Events stream for real-time progress. The backend and hosting run on AWS with CDK-managed infrastructure, using a pnpm workspace to link Wallcrawler packages and provide a scalable, API-driven platform for authentication, authorization, and job discovery.

name: portfolio
summary: portfolio is a Next.js 15 App Router-based portfolio site deployed on AWS via a custom CDK stack using OpenNext packaging, delivering static assets through S3/CloudFront and SSR/API routes via Lambda@Edge. It streams React Server Components with a typed server/client boundary, uses a TailwindCSS-based component library, and sources project data from GitHub for offline summarization and embedding-based search; an OpenAI-powered chat assistant answers questions using precomputed knowledge stored in generated/ with graceful fallbacks to live GitHub queries.

name: rubiks-cube
summary: A React + Next.js + TailwindCSS frontend for managing and visualizing Rubik's cube state in a dynamic 2D flattened layout. It labels each square with face identifiers (U/L/F/R/B/D) and original coordinates for debugging, implements face-specific rotation transforms, provides an initial-state generator, and includes Jest-based tests along with a live demo.

name: slash-siege
summary: slash-siege is a multiplayer stick-figure fighter game hosted on GitHub Pages. The project uses a Trello board for project management and targets Gaming, Multiplayer Gaming, and Entertainment audiences.

name: AWS-IAM-Projects
summary: This repository hosts a UX mock/demo for a redesigned AWS IAM Console built with Polaris internal UI framework, React, and TypeScript. It showcases basic features for the Users entity via AWS IAM APIs and serves as a frontend prototype for identity and access management tooling.

name: personal-website-v1
summary: personal-website-v1 is a first personal portfolio site crafted to showcase work and attract internships, delivered as a static website. It was hosted on AWS using an S3 bucket for storage with CloudFront as a CDN, and also published via GitHub Pages for public access.

name: Parse-Tree-Calculator
summary: Parse-Tree-Calculator is a client-side web-based scientific calculator built with HTML, SASS, and Vanilla JavaScript that evaluates expressions in the browser using a parse-tree approach, supporting decimals, parentheses, and basic trigonometry.

name: AED-Sheets
summary: AED-Sheets is a MEAN-stack web application (MongoDB, Express.js, Angular, Node.js) built for NPRâ€™s internal logging, incident management, and IT ticketing. It enables automatic NPR employee account provisioning, log creation and search, personal and global subscriptions with email or SMS notifications, automatic IT ticket creation, and role-based access control.
